titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the D. Michael Quinn Papers
titlestmt.author: by Lisa Conathan

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday May 4, 2019 at 03:03

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The papers document the life and work of D. Michael Quinn, and include research files, writings, personal correspondence, photographs, and family documents. Research files consist of Quinn's notes, as well as copies and transcripts of primary sources that informed many of Quinn's writings on Mormon history, focusing on Church governance, plural marriage, sexuality and gender relations (especially same-sex relationships), and the involvement of Church members in business and politics. Writings include drafts of articles, lectures, and books by Quinn. Other material includes reviews of Quinn's work and other writings about Quinn. Personal papers document the professional and personal life of D. Michael Quinn from the 1950s to the 2000s.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from D. Michael Quinn on the Frederick W. and Carrie S. Beinecke Fund for Western Americana and the Arthur Corbitt Hoskins Memorial Fund, 1988-2008.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 9-30, 36-37, 39-41, 46-61, 84-85, 88-94, 98-198: Restricted during the lifetime of D. Michael Quinn. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
Box 62 (original computer disk): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Boxes 11, 43, 58, 59, 82, 89, 96, 99, 105, 107, 114, 152 (audiovisual material): Use of originals is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The D. Michael Quinn Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: D. Michael Quinn Papers. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

This collection received a basic level of processing at or around the time of acquisition, including rehousing and minimal organization. Additional processing was carried out in 2011. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below, titled according to month and year of acquisition.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.
Former call numbers: Uncat WA MS 98, Uncat WA MS 119, Uncat WA MS 155, Uncat WA MS 229, Uncat WA MS 236, Uncat WA MS 244, Uncat MSS 758, Uncat MSS 936, Uncat MSS 1046

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Portions of the collection are available on microfilm, as noted on folder labels.

bioghist.head: D. Michael Quinn (born 1944)
bioghist.p: D. Michael Quinn (born March 26, 1944) is a historian who specializes in the history of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (also known as the Mormon Church or LDS). As a young man, Quinn served for two years on a Latter-day Saints Church mission in England. After graduating from college, he served for three years in the U.S. Army. Quinn received a Ph.D. in History from Yale University in 1976. He taught at Brigham Young University from 1976 until he resigned in 1988. In September 1993, Quinn, along with five other Mormon writers, was excommunicated by the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. His many publications focus on the history of LDS Church governance and organization, sexuality and gender relations (especially same-sex relationships), and plural marriage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers document the life and work of D. Michael Quinn, and include research files, writings, personal correspondence, photographs, and family documents. Research files consist of Quinn's notes, as well as copies and transcripts of primary sources that informed many of Quinn's writings on Mormon history, focusing on Church governance, plural marriage, sexuality and gender relations (especially same-sex relationships), and the involvement of Church members in business and politics. Writings include drafts of articles, lectures, and books by Quinn. Other material includes reviews of Quinn's work and other writings about Quinn. Personal papers document the professional and personal life of D. Michael Quinn from the 1950s to the 2000s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into thirteen groupings: I. October 1988 Acquisition. II. September 1989 Acquisition. III. June 1991 Acquisition. IV. February 1992 Acquisition. V. October 1992 Acquisition. VI. January 1993 Acquisition. VII. December 1996 Acquisition. VIII. December 1997 Acquisition. IX. February 1999 Acquisitions. X. March 1999 Acquisition. XI. June 2003 Acquisition. XII. February 2007 Acquisition. XIII. October 2008 Acquisition. XIV. January 2014 Acquisition. XV. January 2015 Acquisition. XVI. November 2018 Acquisition.

Material within this collection has been organized by acquisition reflecting the fact that the collection has been acquired in increments over time. Researchers should note that material within each acquisition overlaps with or relates to material found in other acquisitions. For example, correspondence and writings can be found in most of the thirteen groupings. In order to locate all relevant material within this collection, researchers will need to consult each acquisition described in the Collection Contents section.
Researchers should also note that similar material can be arranged differently in each acquisition, depending on how the material was organized when it was received by the library.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Former call number: Uncat WA MS 98

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized under two headings: Research Files, and Personal Papers (Restricted).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The acquisition consists of research files, writings, correspondence, diaries, and scrapbooks. Research files include transcripts of primary sources (diaries, correspondence, and church records) housed in the archives of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. Writings consist of drafts and printed versions of articles and longer works on Mormon history by D. Michael Quinn. Diaries and scrapbooks document the life of D. Michael Quinn from the 1944 to the 1970s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized under two headings: Research Files, and Personal Papers (Restricted).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Several February 1999 acquisitions are filed together under this heading.

Research files include photocopies and transcripts of historical documents, including documents from the archives of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. Index cards contain notes on diverse topics relating to nineteenth and twentieth-century Mormon history. Writings include drafts of articles from the 1990s. Personal papers include records that document D. Michael Quinn's family history.
